Gas prices are a highly visible economic indicator in the US, as [almost 90%](https://www.consumeraffairs.com/automotive/number-of-drivers-in-us.html) of American adults drive. Gas prices have an outsized [effect on consumer sentiment](https://www.convenience.org/Media/Daily/2022/Oct/27/1-Gas-Prices-Impact-Consumer-Sentiment_Consumers), and consequently play a significant role [when it comes to elections](https://www.spglobal.com/commodityinsights/en/market-insights/latest-news/oil/062624-us-elections-gasoline-price-fluctuations-could-play-role-in-2024-presidential-election). President-elect Donald Trump raised the issue of gas prices repeatedly during his campaign and [promised to bring gas prices down](https://www.yahoo.com/news/trump-says-elected-president-ll-202724792.html).

The US Energy Information Administration (EIA) regularly publishes [national retail gasoline prices](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/pet/hist/LeafHandler.ashx?n=pet\&s=emm_epmr_pte_nus_dpg\&f=m) based on a volume-weighted [survey sample](https://www.eia.gov/petroleum/gasdiesel/gas_proc-methods.php) of retail gasoline outlets.
question_description.141: While the United States has strong constitutional protections for freedom of the press, the use of federal criminal charges has occurred, albeit rarely, in its history. When such prosecutions occur, they typically involve allegations related to national security, unauthorized possession or dissemination of classified information, or obstruction of justice. In some instances, journalists have faced legal exposure for refusing to reveal sources, trespassing during newsgathering, or alleged violations of computer or wiretapping laws. In his second term, President Trump has been critical of the press and has[<u> previously called for the jailing of journalists who publish leaked materials</u>](https://thehill.com/homenews/3820172-trump-calls-for-jailing-journalists-who-broke-supreme-courts-draft-abortion-decision/).
question_description.142:
[Chatbot Arena](https://lmarena.ai/) is a platform for crowdsourced AI comparisons, hosted by researchers at UC Berkeley. Users are presented with two, anonymous LLMs and are asked to vote for the one whose answers they prefer. These votes determine the scores of the models which are then ranked in a global leaderboard.

As of December 29, 2024, Chatbot Arena includes 187 models, ranked by 2,488,392 votes. The top two models in the Overall leaderboard, which encompasses all dialogues, are versions of Gemini by Google, followed by GPT-4o and o1 by OpenAI.
question_description.143:
Vox is a political party founded in 2013 in Spain, classified by political scientists and media outlets as a far-right or right-wing populist party. In recent years, its support among young voters has attracted significant attention. According to [ <u>recent 40dB polls</u> ](https://ep00.epimg.net/infografias/encuestas40db/2025/02-barometro/2025_02_barometro_voto.pdf) published by El País, Vox receives 27% support among voters aged 18-24, its highest percentage across all age groups. This is notably higher than its support among older demographics, which ranges from 10-19%.

 This pattern of increased youth support for far-right parties [ <u>is not unique to Spain</u> ](https://elpais.com/internacional/2024-06-15/el-voto-de-los-jovenes-a-la-extrema-derecha-crece-en-los-cinco-mayores-paises-de-la-ue.html), as Marine Le Pen's RN in France and AfD in Germany have also seen an increase in youth support in recent years.
question_description.144:
The federal budget process in the United States begins with the passage of a [budget resolution](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#how-does-congress-start-the-cbpp-anchor) — a concurrent resolution passed by both the House and Senate that sets broad fiscal targets for spending, revenue, the deficit, and debt levels. While it provides a framework for the upcoming fiscal year, it does not become law and does not require the president’s signature. Importantly, the budget resolution may include reconciliation instructions, which direct specific congressional committees to draft legislation that meets the resolution’s fiscal goals. These instructions are optional but allow for the creation of a [reconciliation bill](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation), which allows the Senate to pass certain budget-related laws with a simple majority vote and limited debate, bypassing the [filibuster](https://www.senate.gov/about/powers-procedures/filibusters-cloture.htm).

If reconciliation instructions are included, the resulting reconciliation bill must be passed by both chambers and signed by the president to become law. It can include changes to spending, revenue, or the debt limit, but is restricted by rules such as the [Byrd Rule](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#what-is-the-byrd-rule-cbpp-anchor), which prohibits provisions unrelated to budget changes. If the budget resolution does not include reconciliation instructions, Congress must enact any fiscal changes through the regular legislative process. In this case, changes to [discretionary spending](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/#the-difference-between-mandatory-discretionary-and-supplemental-spending) are made through the annual appropriations bills, which fund specific government departments and require presidential approval. Changes to mandatory spending programs (like Medicare, [Medicaid](https://usafacts.org/articles/how-much-of-the-federal-budget-is-mandatory-spending/), or Social Security), however, require standalone legislation that amends the law governing those programs. These also must pass both chambers and be signed by the president, and they generally face a higher procedural hurdle in the Senate due to the possibility of a filibuster.

House and Senate Republicans have passed separate budget resolutions in March and April 2025, with the Senate version calling for approximately \$4 billion in spending cuts, and the House version aiming for \$1.5 trillion in cuts. The total impact on the deficit over 10 years is reported by the Bipartisan Policy Center as follows for the [Senate version](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/whats-in-the-fy2025-senate-budget-resolution/):

> While the reconciliation bill’s ultimate deficit impact is yet to be determined, the topline instructions in the Senate allow for an up to \$2 trillion deficit increase over 10 years. Due to overlapping instructions between committees and the use of a [“current policy” baseline](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/the-2025-tax-debate-all-about-that-baseline/), the actual topline is an up to <u>\$5.7 trillion deficit increase</u>.

And for the [House version](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/whats-in-the-fy2025-house-budget-resolution/):

> Republicans hope to leverage the reconciliation process this year to extend and expand on [expiring tax cuts](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/tax/). While the reconciliation bill’s ultimate deficit impact is yet to be determined, the topline instructions allow for an up to \$3.3 trillion deficit increase over 10 years.

President Trump has so far [backed the Senate version](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-johnson-urge-gop-to-back-budget-resolution/), though there is some opposition to this version among House Republicans.

The [Congressional Budget Office](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congressional_Budget_Office) (CBO) is required to produce [cost estimates](https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates) for many bills passed by Congress, and [uses a current-law baseline](https://www.pgpf.org/article/why-do-budget-baselines-matter/), as opposed to a current-policy baseline. For example, for the 2022 [Inflation Reduction Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inflation_Reduction_Act), the most recently enacted reconciliation bill as of April 2025, CBO [estimated](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/58455) a net decrease in the deficit from changes to direct spending and revenue of approximately \$58 billion over 10 years, as well as a nonscorable increase in revenue from IRS enforcement of \$180 billion, a total estimated decrease of \$238 billion decrease in the deficit over 10 years.

question_resolution_criteria.0:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following happen before September 1, 2025:

1. Kemi Badenoch formally announces her intention to resign.
2. Kemi Badenoch loses an internal vote confidence held by the 1922 committee.
3. A leadership election is held to elect the leader of the Conservative Party, even if Kemi Badenoch is a candidate.
question_resolution_criteria.1: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the price of Bitcoin at the end of December 31st, 2025 (or the last available day of record) is above $93,429.20, according to the Closing value on its [ <u>page on CoinMarketCap</u> ](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/historical-data/). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.2:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the US Supreme Court holds in its 2025 decision pertaining to birthright citizenship that the Fourteenth Amendment does **not** require birthright citizenship for at least some children born in the United States who currently qualify.

The question will immediately resolve **No** if the Supreme Court issues an opinion that upholds the status quo of birthright citizenship and Metaculus assesses the opinion reflects a final judgment on the merits.
question_resolution_criteria.3: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Kneecap officially performs at Glastonbury 2025, scheduled for June 25 to June 29, 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.4:
This question resolves as **Yes** if legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that (according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions)) eliminates transferability of one or more of the following tax credits: 

* [Clean Electricity Investment Tax Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/)
* [Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 45Y](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-production-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45y/)
* [Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 45X](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45x/)
question_resolution_criteria.5:
This question will resolve as **Repealed fully** if a federal bill is enacted before January 1, 2026 which eliminates all adders to the Investment Tax Credit (48E) and the Production Tax Credit (45Y) established by the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act.

It will resolve as **Reduced incentives** If a federal bill is enacted before January 1, 2026 which either:

* removes at least one but not all adders to 48E or 45Y (e.g. specifically removes the adder for "prevailing wages"), or
* reduces the absolute amount or percentage of at least one adder to 48E or 45Y (e.g. reduces the "Siting in Energy Community" adder from 0.3c/kWh to 0.2c/kWh).

If no bill reducing or repealing the 48E or 45Y adders is enacted before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Neither repealed nor reduced**.

For the purposes of this question, an adder is any provision that can conditionally increase either the Investment Tax Credit or Production Tax Credit available to US clean energy projects beyond the base credit, including any credits available conditional on worker wages or apprenticeships.
question_resolution_criteria.6: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2027, the International Court of Justice finds that Israel has violated international law in South Africa's genocide case. If this does not happen before January 1, 2027, this question will resolve as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.7: This question will resolve as **Yes** for the person who is selected by the Democratic Party as the Democratic nominee for President of the United States for the [2028 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2028_United_States_presidential_election). If someone other than a named individual is selected this question will resolve as **Other**.
question_resolution_criteria.8: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's net approval rating, defined as approval minus disapproval, on November 2, 2026, according to data from the [Silver Bulletin](https://www.natesilver.net/p/trump-approval-ratings-nate-silver-bulletin).
question_resolution_criteria.9: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Bank of England Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA) announces that Revolut has received a full UK banking license before July 26, 2025, GMT.
question_resolution_criteria.10:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 3, 2027, a United States federal or state government formally establishes a program that provides monetary rewards to civilians for providing information leading to the deportation of individuals from the US.

For this question to resolve as Yes:

* The program must be officially established by a federal executive branch department (e.g., DHS, ICE, DOJ), a state executive branch agency, or a federal or state legislature through enacted legislation.
* The program must offer monetary compensation or financial incentives in exchange for providing information that contributes to the deportation of undocumented immigrants or individuals otherwise subject to removal proceedings.
* The program must become active before January 1, 2027.

This question will not resolve as Yes if:

* There is no monetary reward involved (e.g., a general tip line or anonymous reporting system without financial compensation).
* The program is proposed or debated but not officially established and implemented before the deadline.
* The program is created only by a private organization rather than a government entity.
* The monetary rewards are only offered to law enforcement officers or government employees, rather than civilians.
question_resolution_criteria.11: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before August 16, 2025, Newcastle United Football Club officially and explicitly announce that the club badge will not be redesigned. It will also resolve as **Yes** if a new design is announced and, before August 16, 2025, Newcastle officially announces that they will revert to the old design.
question_resolution_criteria.12:
This question will resolve as the period when a bilateral ceasefire or peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine first officially enters into effect, as declared by both governments. The question resolves based on when the agreement is officially implemented, regardless of whether individual violations occur afterward. An agreement is bilateral if it applies to both Russian and Ukrainian official military forces.

The question will be resolved using the day the ceasefire first goes into effect. There is no requirement that the ceasefire actually lasts for its intended duration.

The ceasefire must formally prohibit offensive combat operations (including artillery/missile strikes, ground assaults, aerial bombardment, and naval attacks) across all official and disputed Ukrainian and Russian territory. Continued non-combat military activities (such as resupply, fortification, aerial patrols, or casualty recovery) will not affect resolution. A limited ceasefire (such as granting safety to humanitarian corridors or specific regions) is insufficient to resolve the question.
question_resolution_criteria.13: This question will be answered **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, OpenAI publishes a paper (e.g., a blog post, article, or video, but not a tweet) announcing the existence of GPT-5.
question_resolution_criteria.14:
This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

1. The Iranian government states that it has a nuclear weapon, and [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) deem the statement to be credible.
2. The Iranian government states that it has tested a nuclear weapon at any time, and [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) deem the statement to be credible.
3. At least one of these three sources, which will be considered per se authoritative for purposes of this question, reports that Iran possesses or has tested a nuclear weapon: the [Arms Control Association](https://www.armscontrol.org/factsheets/nuclear-weapons-who-has-what-glance), the [Stockholm International Peace Research Institute](https://www.sipri.org/) and the [Federation of American Scientists](https://fas.org/initiative/status-world-nuclear-forces/).

A "nuclear weapon" is defined as a device designed for military use that uses nuclear reactions to cause an explosion. Mere possession of weapons-grade uranium or development of related technology will not satisfy the resolution criteria.
question_resolution_criteria.15: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is awarded any Nobel Peace Prize before January 1, 2029, according to the [official site](https://www.nobelpeaceprize.org/) or credible sources.
question_resolution_criteria.16: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, in calendar year 2025, the US Congress has passed a bill which implements a 10% or greater across-the-board tariff on nearly all imports from all countries (or other across-the-board fee on imports, see the fine print for details). The tariff will still be considered to be across-the-board if it excludes 10 or fewer UN member states.
question_resolution_criteria.17: This question resolves as **Yes** if President Donald Trump or the US government publicly states before May 1, 2026 that Jerome Powell is terminated, dismissed, or forcibly replaced (resignations or voluntary departures do not count) before his scheduled term end date of May 15, 2026, from either his role as Chair of the [Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System](https://www.federalreserve.gov/aboutthefed.htm) (FRB) or his role as Chair of the [Federal Open Market Committee](https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomc.htm) (FOMC).
question_resolution_criteria.18: This question will resolve as Yes if a federal judge issues a decision finding the Trump administration in violation of the Impoundment Control Act (2 U.S.C. §§ 681–688) for attempting to permanently withhold or cancel congressionally allocated funds before September 30, 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.19:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit ([26 U.S. Code § 45Y](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-production-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45y/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Y is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Y is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45Y or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.20:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, at any time before July 1, 2027, the House of Representatives seats an individual as a member who was not certified as the winner of their election by the [<u>relevant state authorities</u>](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1d-V0OQGaN7TF289Qy4L8ot1kaZBFLD8BExHNhvQituw/edit?gid=420665400#gid=420665400). 

It will resolve as **No** if no such individual is seated by that time.
question_resolution_criteria.21: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during calendar year 2025, Israel establishes a formal government in the Gaza Strip headed primarily by Israelis or otherwise takes formal control of key territory in the Gaza Strip.
question_resolution_criteria.22:
This question is conditional and will only resolve if a comprehensive bilateral ceasefire or peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine takes effect before 00:00 January 1, 2026 Ukraine Time (UTC+2). If no such ceasefire occurs by that date, the question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve based on the number of consecutive days the ceasefire remains in effect before being abandoned. The ceasefire will be considered to have ended when any of the following occur:

* Either government officially withdraws from the ceasefire or declares the ceasefire terminated
* Major military operations resume that are acknowledged by international observers to constitute a breakdown of the ceasefire (see Notes/Fine Print).
* The ceasefire reaches its predetermined end date without being extended or renewed.
question_resolution_criteria.23: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 20, 2029, the US government orders the [New York Stock Exchange](https://www.nyse.com/index) (NYSE) or the [National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations](https://www.nasdaq.com) (Nasdaq) stock markets to be closed for one or more entire regularly-scheduled trading days.
question_resolution_criteria.24:
This question will resolve as the outcome that next occurs with respect to the tax credit of up to \$7,500 under [Internal Revenue Code § 30D](https://www.energy.gov/mesc/30d-new-clean-vehicle-credit) on the purchase of a new, qualified plug-in electric vehicle.

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**Eliminated**: The EV tax credit is completely eliminated such that it stops being in effect before January 1, 2027.

**Reduced**: The EV tax credit is reduced. For purposes of this question, "reduced" is defined as one or more of the following five outcomes:

* The tax credit is scheduled to sunset for vehicles purchased after December 31, 2026 and before January 1, 2032. (Note: the EV tax credit is [currently scheduled](https://www.irs.gov/credits-deductions/credits-for-new-clean-vehicles-purchased-in-2023-or-after) to apply to vehicles purchased through 2032.)
* The maximum amount of \$7,500 is decreased.  
* Per-manufacturer vehicle caps are added. 
* The vehicle's manufacturer suggested retail price (MSRP) is lowered from \$80,000 for vans, sport utility vehicles and pickup trucks; and \$55,000 for other vehicles.
* Means testing: reducing income eligibility for the tax credit, currently \$300,000 for married couples, \$150,000 for single filers and \$225,000 for heads of household.

If neither of the above happen before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Neither eliminated nor reduced**.
question_resolution_criteria.25:
This question resolves as **Yes** if cloture is successfully invoked in the United States Senate of the 119th Congress or the 120th Congress with less than three-fifths of all the Senators duly chosen and sworn, before January 3, 2029, on any debatable matter before the US Senate for which cloture currently requires the vote of at least three-fifths of the Senators. Otherwise the question resolves as **No**. 

The resolution source for the Senate of the 119th Congress is at: [https://www.senate.gov/legislative/cloture/119.htm](https://www.senate.gov/legislative/cloture/119.htm). The resolution source for the Senate of the 120th Congress (which is scheduled to begin on January 3, 2027) is expected to be at: [https://www.senate.gov/legislative/cloture/120.htm](https://www.senate.gov/legislative/cloture/120.htm)
question_resolution_criteria.26: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Norwegian government officially announces it has selected a new  frigate design before September 1, 2025, CET.
question_resolution_criteria.27: This question will resolve as the number of birds killed in the United States during calendar year 2025 due to highly pathogenic avian influenza. The question will resolve according to the [USDA's Confirmed HPAI Detections table](https://www.aphis.usda.gov/livestock-poultry-disease/avian/avian-influenza/hpai-detections/commercial-backyard-flocks), using the sum of "Birds Affected" where the "Confirmation Date" occurs during calendar year 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.28:
The question will resolve as **Yes** if the share price of BP ([BP.L](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/BP.L/history/)) outperforms Shell ([SHEL.L](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/SHEL.L/history/)) from June 2, 2025 through July 31, 2025, according to the Close column of Yahoo! Finance.

To resolve the question, the relative share price change between June 2, 2025 (initial) and July 31, 2025 (final) will be calculated for both companies:

$$
\frac{P_{\mathrm{BP},\,\mathrm{final}} - P_{\mathrm{BP},\,\mathrm{initial}}}{P_{\mathrm{BP},\,\mathrm{initial}}}
>  
\frac{P_{\mathrm{SHELL},\,\mathrm{final}} - P_{\mathrm{SHELL},\,\mathrm{initial}}}{P_{\mathrm{SHELL},\,\mathrm{initial}}}
$$
question_resolution_criteria.29: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Benjamin Netanyahu has remained the Prime Minister of Israel for the entire duration from January 1, 2025 to December 31, 2025, inclusive. If Netanyahu ceases to be the Prime Minister at any point during 2025, this question will resolve as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.30: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the net favorability rating of Donald Trump for December 20, 2025 is "Favorable" [as reported by 538](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/favorability/donald-trump/). The resolution will be based on the already-calculated net rating presented by 538.
question_resolution_criteria.31: This question will resolve as the effective tariff rate on goods being imported into the United States in the fourth quarter of 2026, according to the [Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis (FRED)](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/graph/?g=1wn5e)
question_resolution_criteria.32:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Argentina's year-over-year inflation rate is strictly less than 30.0% for the month of December 2025, according to the National Institute of Statistics and Censuses of Argentina (INDEC), whose monthly report can be accessed [here](https://sdds.indec.gob.ar/nsdp.htm).

This question will resolve based on the "Anual Growth Rate (%)" value found for "Consumer Prices" when the "Date of Latest" value is Dec-25.
question_resolution_criteria.33: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 3, 2027, a United States federal judge is impeached by the US House of Representatives with fewer than half of Democratic representatives voting for the impeachment.
question_resolution_criteria.34: This question resolves as **Yes** if Drought Monitor at [this link](https://www.drought.gov/states/florida) lists greater than or equal to 14.0 million Florida residents in areas of drought, when the link is accessed by Metaculus on or after June 28, 2025. If the number is below that, this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.35: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the [ <u>World Inequality Database</u> ](https://wid.world/) (WID) estimates that the "[ <u>Median national wealth at market value per adult</u> ](https://wid.world/world/#anweal_p0p100_z/WO/last/eu/k/p/yearly/a/false/48929.56/125000/curve/false/country)" for 2024 is higher than that in 2023. It will be resolved as **No** otherwise or if the value is equal to or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.36:
This question will resolve as the party that holds more US Senate seats than any other party in the 120th Congress, which is the one scheduled to be elected November 3, 2026 and take office in January 3, 2027.

Independent senators will be counted as part of the party they caucus with.

This question will resolve as **Other** if:

* A third party holds more seats than both Republicans and Democrats.
* Independents that do not caucus with either party hold more seats than both Republicans and Democrats.
* More seats are vacant than the ones held by both Republicans and Democrats.

If Republicans and Democrats hold an equal number of seats in the Senate and this question does not resolve as **Other**, it will resolve as **Republicans**, as the Vice President can cast the tie-breaking vote.
question_resolution_criteria.37:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following happens after December 31, 2024 before January 1, 2026:

* A New Drug Application (NDA) for the treatment of a mental disorder (as defined by the [Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Illnesses](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/articles/24291-diagnostic-and-statistical-manual-dsm-5), the DSM-5) is filed to the FDA for a psychedelic.
* An application for an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for the treatment of a mental disorder (as defined by the DSM-5) is filed to the FDA for a psychedelic.
* The DEA reschedules any psychedelic under the U.S. Controlled Substances Act to a less restrictive schedule (e.g., from Schedule I to Schedule II).

For the purposes of this questions, a psychedelic is defined broadly and includes:

* psychedelic indolealkylamines(e.g. LSD, psilocybin, DMT)
* psychedelic phenylethylamines (e.g. mescaline, MDMA, the 2C series)
* arylcycloalkylamines with psychedelic or dissociative effects (e.g. PCP, ketamine)
* Salvinorin A

Cannabinoids (e.g. THC) are *not* considered psychedelics for the purposes of this question.
question_resolution_criteria.38:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, at any time before September 1, 2025, the DHS formally revokes or suspends the SEVP certification of at least one university in the Ivy League, thereby preventing the affected institution from enrolling new international students under F or M visas.

It will resolve as **No** if no Ivy League SEVP certification is revoked or suspended before that date.
question_resolution_criteria.39:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Nvidia's stock outperforms the S\&P 500 in 2025. If its return is less than or equal to that of the S\&P 500, this question resolves as **No**.

The resolution sources are: 

* The Yahoo Finance history page for [NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA)](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/NVDA/history/).[](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/NVDA/history/)
* The Yahoo Finance history for the [SPDR S\&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY)](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/SPY/history/).
question_resolution_criteria.40: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report the White House revokes the media credentials of two or more reporters from at least two previously credentialed media outlets before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.41:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if military conflict between India and Pakistan results in at least 100 deaths after May 1 and before July 1, 2025, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).

Independent estimates of the number of deaths will be prioritised in resolving this question. These may include cases where an independent organisation has reviewed and explicitly endorsed one side's death figures. If no such estimates are available or if they are judged by Metaculus to be in error, this question will resolve according to each side's count of their own dead.
question_resolution_criteria.42: The question will be answered as **Yes** if Pedro Sánchez holds the office of Prime Minister of Spain at the end of the day on December 31, 2025. It will be answered as **No** if he does not hold that office at that time. Confirmation will be based on official sources.
question_resolution_criteria.44: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Effective Federal Funds Rate on December 31, 2025 is lower than 4.33%, according to the [Federal Reserve Bank of New York](https://www.newyorkfed.org/markets/reference-rates/effr).
question_resolution_criteria.45: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to the final worldwide box office data for 2025—as reported by a reliable source such as [ <u>Box Office Mojo</u> ](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/year/world/2025/)—the film with the highest total gross is a franchise film (i.e., part of a series or cinematic universe). It will be resolved as **No** if the highest-grossing film is not part of a franchise. In the event of a tie for first place, the question will be resolved as **Yes**.
question_resolution_criteria.46: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the median price for "Democratic" is higher than the median price for "Republican" on the Kalshi market [*Which party will win the 2028 Presidential Election?*](https://kalshi.com/markets/kxpresparty/party-winning-presidency), for the dates December 25, 2025, to December 31, 2025, inclusive.
question_resolution_criteria.47: This question will resolve as **Yes** if bitcoin has a "High" price of 200,000 USD or more on any single day of 2025, according to the historical data by [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/BTC-USD/history/).
question_resolution_criteria.48: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions), either a new armed conflict or a substantial escalation of a previous conflict has resulted in at least 5,000 deaths within the calendar year 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.49: The question will resolve as Yes if the governments of both the United States and Denmark, separately or jointly, announce formal negotiations over the possible transfer of sovereignty of Greenland to the United States before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.50:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if a single AI system outperforms a team of top human forecasters in a forecasting tournament before January 1, 2030.

If this question has not resolved as **Yes** and no such comparison has been made between AIs and top human forecasters in the two year period 2028-2029, this question will be **annulled**.

If at least one comparison has been made in the two year period 2028-2029, but no AI has outperformed a team of top human forecasters before January 1, 2030, this question will resolve as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.52: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, in 2029, at least one frontier AI model is publicly released without undergoing a third-party evaluation of dangerous capabilities.
question_resolution_criteria.53: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the monthly U-3 unemployment figure, in percent, seasonally adjusted, for November 2025 is lower than 4.2%. Resolution will be determined according to the first estimate published for November 2025 by the BLS, typically found [here](https://www.bls.gov/news.release/empsit.nr0.htm).
question_resolution_criteria.54: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, according to [the National Institute of Statistics and Censuses of Argentina (INDEC)](https://www.indec.gob.ar/indec/web/Nivel3-Tema-4-46), the percentage of the population living below the poverty line in Argentina (*Población bajo la línea de pobreza*) in the first half of 2025 is less than 41.7%. If the percentage is greater than or equal to 41.7%, this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.55: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, an application is filed at the German Federal Constitutional Court to ban the Alternative for Germany (AfD) political party at the federal level, by the Federal Government, the Bundestag, or the Bundesrat
question_resolution_criteria.56:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the US dollar is greater than 50% of global allocated foreign exchange reserves reported at the International Monetary Fund's Currency Composition of Official Foreign Exchange Reserve (IMF COFER) [data page](https://data.imf.org/?sk=e6a5f467-c14b-4aa8-9f6d-5a09ec4e62a4) for each quarter after 2024 through and including the 3rd quarter of 2028.

If there is at least one quarter in which the US dollar is equal to or less than 50% of global allocated foreign exchange reserves, then this question resolves as **No**.

The percentage will be calculated for each quarter by dividing Claims in US dollars under Allocated Reserves by the total amount of Allocated Reserves.
question_resolution_criteria.57:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one previously not invited country is invited to join BRICS as a full member during or before the 17th BRICS summit.

This question will only resolve based upon an invitation for full membership, not partner status or any other status in the organisation.
question_resolution_criteria.58: This question will resolve based on the [Zillow Home Values Index](https://www.zillow.com/research/data/) (ZHVI) and specifically the "ZHVI All Homes (SFR, Condo/Co-op) Time Series, Smoothed, Seasonally Adjusted(\$)" data type for "Metro & U.S.". It will resolve as **Yes** if the relative change of the ZHVI for the United States from November 2024 to November 2025 is greater than the relative change from November 2023 to November 2024, when adjusted for inflation.
question_resolution_criteria.59: This question will resolve as the US per capita consumption of chicken for 2025, according to the [National Chicken Council](https://www.nationalchickencouncil.org/statistic/per-capita-consumption-poultry/). Specifically, it will resolve as the value for "Total Chicken" given for 2025 when that is no longer an estimate.
question_resolution_criteria.60:
This question will resolve as the 2025 period in which the US Congress has successfully passed *any* bill via the special parliamentary procedure of reconciliation and said bill is signed by the President into law.

Should no such bill be passed and signed before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Not in 2025**.
question_resolution_criteria.61:
This question will resolve as **"Yes"** if, at any time before January 21, 2029, Eastern Time, the United States is exercising **de facto control** over the territory of the Panama Canal.

The question will resolve as **"No"** if this does not occur before January 21, 2029, Eastern Time.
question_resolution_criteria.62:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit ([26 U.S. Code § 45X](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45x/)), when it pays out 100% of the credit value (explained further in the Fine Print).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2026 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2025) or 45X is fully repealed, effective either in 2026 or 2025.

**2027 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2027 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2026).

**2028 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2028 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2027).

**2029 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2029 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2028).

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45X, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.63: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, by January 1st, 2026, Bluesky's user count reaches 100 million or more, according to [ <u>Jazco's Bluesky Stats</u> ](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats) or another credible source. If the reported number is below 100 million, the question will be resolved as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.64:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Hydrogen Production Tax Credit (45V) ([26 U.S. Code § 45V](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/credit-for-production-of-clean-hydrogen-26-u-s-code-%c2%a7-45v/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45V is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45V is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45V or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.65: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the official closing value of the Ibex 35 on the last business day of 2025 (normally December 31st or the previous session if it falls on a holiday) exceeds 11,595.00, according to the Close column of [ <u>its page on Yahoo Finance</u> ](https://uk.finance.yahoo.com/quote/%5EIBEX/history/). It will be resolved as **No** if the value is equal to or less than €11,595.00.
question_resolution_criteria.66: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have reported more than 10,000 cumulative cases of H5 avian influenza in the United States. For the purposes of this question, in the event CDC uses case categorizations, confirmed and probable cases will count, suspected cases do not. Resolution will be determined according to publicly available reports published by the CDC, currently available at [this link](https://www.cdc.gov/bird-flu/situation-summary/index.html).
question_resolution_criteria.67: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any single participant of the current, Summer 2025 Metaculus Cup earns at least \$750 in commenting prizes.
question_resolution_criteria.68:
This question will resolve as the entity or group who holds de facto power in Gaza City on August 31, 2025. De facto power will generally be considered to be held by the group which has ultimate decision-making authority over greater than 50% of the area of Gaza City. Resolution will be determined according to publicly accessible information from [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) published on or before August 31, 2025.

The options are described and defined as follows:

* [**Hamas**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas)**:** The organization which held de facto power in Gaza City following its 2007 rise to power until approximately November 7, 2023 ([AP](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-war-news-11-7-2023-6e1425d218de6a73f8a51e4c036cfd39)) (after which the city became contested), and then from late January 2025 ([NYT](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/23/world/middleeast/hamas-gaza-israel-cease-fire.html)) until Gaza City became contested again on March 19, 2025 upon the launch of the IDF's new ground operation. ([Jerusalem Post](https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/article-846777)) 
* **Israel:** The state of Israel, which will be considered to have de facto authority if it has has clear military control of a majority of Gaza City by area and does not recognize any other governing authority or if one or more individuals who are both a citizen and official representative of Israel control the governing body.
* [**Palestinian Authority**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_National_Authority) **/** [**Fatah**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatah)**:** This question will resolve as this option if either the Palestinian Authority or Fatah have de facto control, even if Fatah no longer controls the Palestinian Authority at the time.
* **International Government:** International government will be considered to be a governing body controlled by official representatives of countries which are not Israel or Palestine. For example, [the Coalition Provisional Authority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coalition_Provisional_Authority#Reconstruction) (CPA) established in Iraq in 2003 would qualify. In that case there was an [Iraqi Governing Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_Governing_Council) consisting of Iraqi leaders, however, this council was subordinate to the CPA.
* **Shared Power:** Shared power will be considered to be a governing body consisting of representatives of multiple entities, controlled by local parties (e.g., Hamas, the Palestinian Authority, or Israel). For example, de facto control by a council made up of both Israeli officials and members of the Palestinian Authority would be classified as shared power, as would a council made up of both Hamas and Fatah.
* **Contested:** Contested is defined as a situation where multiple groups are still vying for de facto control of the majority of Gaza City and it is not clear whether any group holds it and governs greater than 50% of the city's territory. This will generally not be considered to be the case when there is a clear governing body with exclusive administrative power, but the governing body consists of competing parties or it is unclear who controls the governing body. Instead, this option represents the case where there is no clear governing body with de facto control of the majority of Gaza City.
question_resolution_criteria.69: This question will resolve as **Yes** if California’s 2018 Proposition 12, "Prevention of Cruelty to Farm Animals Act", is in effect on January 1, 2026. This question will resolve as **No** if it is not in effect for any reason, including but not limited to being overturned by a federal bill, being suspended by a court, or repealed by the California legislature.
question_resolution_criteria.70:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, prescribing mifepristone for medical abortions in the United States becomes either:

* illegal or
* significantly restricted, as to prevent the majority of pregnancies in their sixth week from being terminated via mifepristone in every state.
question_resolution_criteria.71: This question will resolve as **Yes** if before January 1, 2027, Elon Musk no longer holds the title *Chief Executive Officer* (or an unequivocally equivalent highest-ranking executive title) of Tesla, Inc.
question_resolution_criteria.72:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Carbon Oxide Sequestration Tax Credit under [26 U.S. Code § 45Q](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/credit-for-carbon-oxide-sequestration-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45q/) for the beginning of construction of carbon sequestration facilities or equipment (see also [IRS Instructions for Form 8933](https://www.irs.gov/instructions/i8933)). 

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Q is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Q is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45Q or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.73:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, on any single day (excluding Sundays) after May 19, 2025 and before July 1, 2025, the words "tariff" or "tariffs" appear on neither:

* the digital version of Today’s Paper of The New York Times (accessible [here](https://www.nytimes.com/section/todayspaper) - be careful to select the appropriate date in the *The Times in Print For* box)
* the digital "Print Edition" of the Wall Street Journal (accessible [here](https://www.wsj.com/print-edition/20250515/frontpage) - linked front page is for May 15, 2025, be careful to set the correct date in the URL, the format is: yyyy-mm-dd).
question_resolution_criteria.74: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) or Department of Education (DOE) has opened a civil rights or Title VI compliance investigation into whether diversity-related programs at Harvard University constitute illegal discrimination or preferences before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.75: This question will resolve as the average monthly crude oil production during the months of April, May, and June, 2026, according to [data published by the US Energy Information Administration](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/pet/hist/LeafHandler.ashx?n=PET\&s=MCRFPUS1\&f=M) (EIA). The question will resolve by taking the sum of US field production of crude oil over the three months in question and dividing the sum by three to arrive at the average monthly production.
question_resolution_criteria.76: This question will resolve as the total number of Donald Trump's cabinet-level nominations that were rejected, withdrawn, returned to the president under paragraph 6 of rule XXXI of the standing rules of the Senate, or not acted upon by the Senate for 100 days, before every cabinet-level position has had a confirmed nomination. For a nomination to be considered made, it must be formally submitted to the Senate in 2025 and reflected in the congressional record as such. For the purposes of this question, a nomination is confirmed once the Senate transmits to the president that the nomination has been confirmed and the president commissions the cabinet officer.
question_resolution_criteria.77: This question will resolve as the participant that wins the bet [outlined here](https://garymarcus.substack.com/p/where-will-ai-be-at-the-end-of-2027), according to the participants themselves.
question_resolution_criteria.78:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if a bilateral ceasefire has gone into effect and stood for 30 days, beginning at any point between January 1, 2025 to December 31, 2025, inclusive. A ceasefire is bilateral if it applies to the majorities of combatants on both the Russian and Ukrainian sides, respectively. A ceasefire is deemed to have stood as long as no reliable sources report that the ceasefire has broken down or is no longer effective. If no ceasefire has stood for 30 days before January 30, 2026, this question will resolve as **No**.

The ceasefire must apply to all military operations in all official and disputed Ukrainian and Russian territory. In other words, a limited ceasefire (such as granting safety to humanitarian corridors or specific regions) is insufficient to resolve the question as **Yes**.
question_resolution_criteria.79: This question resolves as **Yes** if, on any date before May 11, 2027, a majority of non-rural Medicare and Medicaid certified Long-Term Care (LTC) facilities in the United States are legally required, by Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) rules or otherwise, to provide a minimum of 3.48 or more total nurse staffing hours per resident day (HPRD) of nursing care. Question resolves according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions), especially any announcements by CMS or any other government agency with the authority to establish the staffing standard. If a national minimum staffing rule has not gone into effect before that date, for any reason, then this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.80: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Nvidia's stock price at the close of the last business day of 2025 (on the primary exchange where it is listed, NASDAQ) exceeds $134.29, according to the Close/Last column on [ <u>its NASDAQ page</u> ](https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/nvda/historical). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.81:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Electricity Investment Tax Credit ([26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 48E is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 48E is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 48E or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.82: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Google's market share for any month during calendar year 2025 is below 85%, according to [Statcounter](https://gs.statcounter.com/search-engine-market-share).
question_resolution_criteria.83:
-This question will resolve to a Yes only if at least eight of the fifteen individuals holding the positions of Secretary for the executive departments (as defined in [<u>5 U.S.C. § 101</u>](https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/5/101)) are officially designated as 'acting' and not confirmed by the Senate or permanently appointed by that date.

\- For this question, the executive departments include State, Treasury, Defense, Justice, Interior, Agriculture, Commerce, Labor, Health and Human Services, Housing and Urban Development, Transportation, Energy, Education, Veterans Affairs, and Homeland Security.

\- If an individual is simultaneously serving in an acting role while also nominated but not yet confirmed, they will still be considered 'acting' for the purpose of this question.

\- Metaculus will resolve this question according to [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) published on or before December 31, 2026, Eastern Time.
question_resolution_criteria.84: This question resolves as **Yes** if at any point after the launch of this question and before January 20, 2029, the value of the US Dollar Index (DXY) averaged over any 90-day period is is less than 88.00, according to  [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/DX-Y.NYB/history/).
question_resolution_criteria.85: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, Eastern Time, Jerome Powell is no longer the Chair of the Federal Reserve.
question_resolution_criteria.86: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) such as the U.S. Treasury Department in its [Combined Statement](https://fiscal.treasury.gov/reports-statements/combined-statement/current.html) or the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) report that customs duties revenue to the federal government is at least \$160 billion in fiscal year 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.87: This question resolves as **Yes** if before January 1, 2026, the World Health Organization (WHO) declares any H5 virus to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC). If this does not occur, this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.88: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that President Trump has formally invoked his constitutional authority to adjourn the United States Congress before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.89: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Maersk announces or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that shipping through the Red Sea has resumed before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.90: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to [ <u>official Eurostat data</u> ](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/news/euro-indicators), Spain's real GDP growth (year-on-year percentage change from Q3 2024 to Q3 2025) exceeds aggregate Eurozone growth over the same period. It will be resolved as **No** if Eurozone growth is equal to or greater.
question_resolution_criteria.91: This question will resolve as **Yes** for the person who is selected by the Republican Party as the Republican nominee for President of the United States for the [2028 United States presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2028_United_States_presidential_election). If someone other than a named individual is selected this question will resolve as **Other**.
question_resolution_criteria.92:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before September 1, 2025, credible sources report that a formal investigation has been opened into financial misconduct relating to tariff announcements between April 2 and April 9, 2025 by any of:

* Department of Justice (DOJ)
* Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)
* a Congressional Oversight committee

If no public reports available before September 1, 2025 indicate this has occurred, the question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.93: This question will resolve as Yes if the National Archivist certifies and publishes the Equal Rights Amendment (ERA) to the Constitution before June 30, 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.94: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Microsoft's stock price at the close of the last business day of 2025 (on the primary exchange where it is listed, NASDAQ) exceeds $421.50, according to the Close/Last column on [ <u>its NASDAQ page</u> ](https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/msft/historical). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.95: This question will resolve as the number of federal employees in November 2026, in thousands, according to data presented for [All Employees, Federal](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CES9091000001) by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis (FRED).
question_resolution_criteria.96:
This question will resolve as the total decrease in Medicaid spending over the period from fiscal year 2025 to 2034, inclusive, enacted as part of a spending reconciliation bill passed during fiscal year 2025. If no such reconciliation bill is enacted before the end of fiscal year 2025 (before October 1, 2025), this question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve according to the cost estimate produced by the [Congressional Budget Office](https://www.cbo.gov/) (CBO) for the enacted reconciliation bill.
question_resolution_criteria.97:
*Note: This question draws on forthcoming 2024 data to align with the Future Perfect forecast.*

This question will resolve as **Yes** if the 2024 total kilograms of medically important antimicrobial drugs sold or distributed for use in food-producing animals in the US is at least 0.5% higher than the same number for 2023.
question_resolution_criteria.98:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, the United States has enacted one or more bills that changes at least three of the six following components of the Affordable Care Act (ACA) to either repeal or curtail them (see the fine print for fuller details):

* Eliminates or reduces the ACA's Medicaid eligibility or federal funding
* Eliminates or reduces the premium tax credit eligibility or amount
* Eliminates or curtails the individual mandate (by law the individual mandate still exists in the ACA, but has no penalty)
* Eliminates or curtails the mandate for certain employers to provide health coverage for employees. Reducing the penalties will also be considered to be relaxing the mandate.
* Makes it so that ACA subsidies are no longer limited to plans that satisfy the requirements specified in the ACA, including allowing ACA subsidies to be contributed to health savings accounts or similar account
* Eliminates or curtails medical underwriting restrictions
question_resolution_criteria.99: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to the graph of the average of polls for the General Elections in Spain, maintained by [ <u>Politico Poll of Polls</u> ](https://www.politico.eu/europe-poll-of-polls/spain/), the PSOE is ahead of the PP in the average voting intention for December 31, 2025. It will be resolved as **No** if the PP is ahead of the PSOE or if they are tied.
question_resolution_criteria.100: The question will be answered as **Yes** if, as of December 31, 2025, the five largest global companies by market capitalization are in the technology sector, according to [ <u>CompaniesMarketCap</u> ](https://companiesmarketcap.com/). It will be answered as **No** if any of the top five are not considered technology companies.
question_resolution_criteria.101: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, in the calendar year 2025, Polymarket or Manifold can legally offer markets in the United States using real money.
question_resolution_criteria.102: If before January 1, 2029, [28 U.S. Code § 1](https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/28/1) is amended to specify that the Supreme Court of the United States shall consist of greater than a total of 9 justices, then this question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise it resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.103:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before October 1, 2025, any of the individual tax cuts from the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (as listed in the Fine Print) are extended via enactment of a reconciliation bill that used a "current policy" baseline in the Senate's budget reconciliation process, as reported by credible sources.

It will resolve as **No** if both a reconciliation bill for spending and a reconciliation bill for revenue are enacted (either as separate bills or a combined bill) before the question has resolved as **Yes**, or if October 1, 2025 is reached without such an extension.
question_resolution_criteria.104: The question will be answered as **Yes** if, according to the sales price data published on the [ <u>Idealista portal</u> ](https://www.idealista.com/sala-de-prensa/informes-precio-vivienda/venta/madrid-comunidad/madrid-provincia/madrid/), the average price of housing in the **city of Madrid** per square meter rises by more than 18% from December 2024 to December 2025. It will be answered as **No** if the increase is 18% or less, or if there is a decrease in prices.
question_resolution_criteria.105:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2028, a federal or state court issues a ruling that results in a change of the recognized winner according to the appropriate state election authorities of a 2026 election for one of the following offices:

* U.S. House of Representatives
* U.S. Senate
* Top statewide elected offices

If the state election authority does not officially determine a winner, the winner will be determined based on reporting by the Associated Press or another [credible source](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).

If no election in one of the offices listed above has been overturned by a court before January 1, 2028, this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.106: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) World Economic Outlook database, India's nominal GDP for 2025 exceeds that of Japan by the end of that year. It will be resolved as **No** if Japan's GDP remains higher or if both are equivalent.
question_resolution_criteria.107: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2026, [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that at least one chamber of Congress (House of Representatives or Senate) has approved legislation that partially or fully exempts at least one executive branch department or agency listed in the Fine Print from the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA).
question_resolution_criteria.108: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, following the 2025 federal election in Canada, Pierre Poilievre is officially appointed Prime Minister. If this does not happen, this question will be resolved as **No**. This includes no election being held before January 1, 2026, or the results of all 2025 elections being annulled.
question_resolution_criteria.109: This question will resolve as the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the classement général, or overall winner, in the Tour de France 2025, based on results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).
question_resolution_criteria.110: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that the current Senate parliamentarian, Elizabeth MacDonough, has been removed from office or resigned before July 1, 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.111: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, as of December 31, 2025 (or the previous trading date), Inditex is among the 10 largest companies by market capitalization in the European Union (EU). It will be resolved as **No** if it is below the 10th position or is not listed at all.
question_resolution_criteria.112:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, the United States has taken either of the following steps to eliminate the Department of Education:

* Passed a bill into law that would eliminate the Department of Education.
* Congress has granted [presidential reorganization authority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_reorganization_authority) that gives the president power to reorganize the government, with **both** of the following subsequently occurring:
  * the president has issued an order under such power to eliminate the Department of Education
  * any oversight procedures specified in the reorganization authority passed by Congress have completed (for example, if a time limit is set on Congress to nullify such presidential orders, the time limit has expired without nullification)

The law need not take effect before the specified date, the passage of any law that abolishes the Department of Education at a future date is sufficient.
question_resolution_criteria.113:
This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) announces a new investigation or prosecution of a high-profile Democrat, which is for purposes of this question defined as an individual who meets any of the following criteria before January 1, 2026:

\- Has served as Democratic President or Vice President of the United States.

\- Has held any of the following leadership roles in the House of Representatives or Senate (Speaker of the House or House Minority/Democratic Leader, Senate Majority or Minority/Democratic Leader, House or Senate Majority/Democratic Whip).

-Has served as an impeachment manager during either of the impeachment proceedings against Donald Trump (2019–2020 or 2020–2021). The 2019-2020 impeachment managers were Adam Schiff, Jerry Nadler, Zoe Lofgren, Hakeem Jeffries, Val Demings, Sylvia Garcia, and Jason Crow. The 2020-2021 impeachment managers were Jamie Raskin, Diana DeGette, David Cicilline, Joaquin Castro, Eric Swalwell, Ted Lieu, Stacey Plaskett, Madeline Dean, and Joe Neguse.
question_resolution_criteria.114:
This question will resolve as the party that holds more House of Representatives seats than any other party in the 120th Congress, which is the one scheduled to be elected November 3, 2026 and take office in January 3, 2027.

Independent representatives will be counted as part of the party they caucus with.

This question will resolve as **Other** if:

* Republicans and Democrats hold an equal number of seats.
* A third party holds more seats than both Republicans and Democrats.
* Independents that do not caucus with either party hold more seats than both Republicans and Democrats.
* More seats are vacant than the ones held by both Republicans and Democrats.
question_resolution_criteria.115:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during calendar year 2025, any one of the listed AI labs below or labs' leadership publicly claims to have created artificial general intelligence (AGI).

* [<u>OpenAI</u>](https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/380117/openai-microsoft-sam-altman-nonprofit-for-profit-foundation-artificial-intelligence)
* [<u>Anthropic</u>](https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/23794855/anthropic-ai-openai-claude-2)
* Google (including [<u>DeepMind</u>](https://deepmind.google/))
* [<u>Microsoft</u>](https://www.theverge.com/24314821/microsoft-ai-ceo-mustafa-suleyman-google-deepmind-openai-inflection-agi-decoder-podcast)
* [<u>Nvidia</u>](https://venturebeat.com/ai/nvidia-just-dropped-a-bombshell-its-new-ai-model-is-open-massive-and-ready-to-rival-gpt-4/)
* [<u>xAI</u>](https://x.ai/)
* [<u>Meta/Facebook</u>](https://ai.meta.com/)
* [<u>Mistral</u>](https://www.axios.com/2024/02/29/mistral-french-ai-startup-microsoft)
* [<u>Databricks</u>](https://www.databricks.com/blog/introducing-dbrx-new-state-art-open-llm)
* [<u>World Labs</u>](https://www.worldlabs.ai/)
* [<u>Safe Superintelligence</u>](https://ssi.inc/)
* [<u>Hugging Face</u>](https://huggingface.co/)
* [<u>Scale AI</u>](https://scale.com/)
* [<u>Magic.dev</u>](https://magic.dev/)
* [<u>Amazon</u>](https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/aws/amazon-nova-artificial-intelligence-bedrock-aws)
* [<u>Apple</u>](https://machinelearning.apple.com/research/introducing-apple-foundation-models)
* [<u>Netflix</u>](https://netflixtechblog.com/supporting-diverse-ml-systems-at-netflix-2d2e6b6d205d)
* [<u>IBM</u>](https://www.ibm.com/watson)
question_resolution_criteria.116: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, a federal bill is enacted that introduces requirements for domestically-produced materials or subcomponents for the Advanced Manufacturing Production Tax Credits (AMPTC) described in [26 U.S. Code § 45X](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45x/).
question_resolution_criteria.117: This question will be resolved to **Yes** if, within 2025, "Grand Theft Auto VI" is available for sale in Europe through standard, authorized distribution channels. If the game is not released in Europe in 2025, the question will be resolved to **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.118: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after January 1, 2025 and before January 1, 2026, any player who has ever been selected as an All-Star in the NFL, NBA, MLB, or NHL is banned or suspended due to sports betting.
question_resolution_criteria.119: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the [Copernicus Climate Change Service/ECMWF](https://climate.copernicus.eu) reports that 2025 was the warmest year on record based on global mean surface air temperature. It will be resolved as **No** if any other year holds the record.
question_resolution_criteria.120: This question resolves as the amount of [Federal Net Outlays](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/FYONET) in the United States in millions of dollars in Fiscal Year 2028, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis (FRED).
question_resolution_criteria.121:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after January 20, 2025 and before January 20, 2029:

* A Federal Open Market Committee member resigns or is removed before their term expires and the US President designates a replacement, OR
* The US President appoints one or more additional members to the FOMC beyond those expected under normal succession (i.e., through replacement of members whose term has expired or who have resigned).

If neither occurs before January 20, 2029, this question will resolve as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.123: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has declared a public health emergency for H5 avian influenza.
question_resolution_criteria.124:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the United States President's Emergency Plan For AIDS Relief ([PEPFAR](https://www.state.gov/pepfar/)) ceases to exist before January 1, 2026. This can come about through any of the following mechanisms:

* the initiative being terminated.
* the initiative and/or its functions merging with or being consolidated into another program or agency, with PEPFAR no longer continuing to operate as a distinct organization.  
* the program having its public funding eliminated by Congress.
question_resolution_criteria.125: This question resolves as **Yes** if, according to the [Bloomberg Billionaires Index](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/), Elon Musk is ranked #1 in net worth when the resolution source is accessed by Metaculus on December 31, 2025. If Musk is not ranked #1, then this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.126:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the United States and Iran sign an agreement restricting Iran's nuclear program after May 12 and before September 1, 2025.

For an agreement to qualify for this question it must meet the following criteria:

1. Contains limits on Iran enriching or stockpiling nuclear materials.
2. Allows monitoring or inspection by parties other than the Iranian Government, such as the International Atomic Energy Agency.
question_resolution_criteria.127: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that President Trump has formally invoked the Insurrection Act before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.128: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, on or before July 1, 2025, Harvard University has a certification under the Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) programme allowing international students to enroll, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_resolution_criteria.129:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, at any time before January 1, 2026, the Department of Justice (DOJ) files a federal criminal [indictment](https://thelawdictionary.org/indictment/) against Christopher Krebs or Miles Taylor, former officials from President Trump’s first administration.

It will resolve as **No** if no such indictment is filed by that time.
question_resolution_criteria.130:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, by January 1, 2026, at least one AI system is documented to achieve greater than 85% performance on the FrontierMath benchmark.

 The achievement must be reported in a document (such as a peer-reviewed paper, conference presentation, official benchmark publication, or a blog post by the AI developer). A simple reference to progress or internal assessments, without published performance results, will not qualify. If these results are not published, the question will be resolved as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.131: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, a federal bill is enacted that makes the [existing requirements](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/n-23-38.pdf) for the domestic content bonus credit mandatory for the Investment Tax Credits (ITC) described [26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/).
question_resolution_criteria.132:
This question will resolve as the NATO defence spending target agreed upon at the 2025 NATO summit between July 24-26, 2025.

If the target agreed upon is not one of the values listed, this question will resolve as the highest value that is lower than the agreed upon target.

If there is a targeted range (such as 3-4%) the lower end of the range will be used.

If there is no new target, or the target is lowered, this question will resolve as **2 or lower**.
question_resolution_criteria.133:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, within calendar year 2025, at least one of the following happens:

1. Xi Jinping ceases to be the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China or the Communist Party of China ceases to be in control of China.
2. Miguel Díaz-Canel ceases to be the First Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba or the Communist Party of Cuba ceases to be in control of Cuba.
3. Ali Hosseini Khamenei ceases to be the supreme leader of Iran.
4. Kim Jong Un ceases to be Supreme Leader of North Korea.
5. Vladimir Putin ceases to be President of Russia.
6. Nicolás Maduro ceases to be President of Venezuela.
question_resolution_criteria.134: This question resolves as **Yes** if sales of battery electric vehicles (BEV) exceed 10% of total light-duty vehicle sales (LDV) in the United States for any complete month before the sales figures reported for October 2025, according to [Argonne National Laboratory's Light Duty Electric Drive Vehicles Monthly Sales Updates - Historical Data](https://www.anl.gov/esia/reference/light-duty-electric-drive-vehicles-monthly-sales-updates-historical-data). If this does not occur, this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.135:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) have reported **both** of the following:

* Elon Musk no longer serves an advisory role to Donald Trump.
