question_fine_print.123:
* To qualify, a public health emergency must be declared which names H5 avian influenza in some form. This could include naming H5 or any subtype of H5, or any name given to H5 or highly pathogenic avian influenza that, in the judgment of Metaculus, encompasses H5 or any subtype of H5. Announcements of public health emergencies are typically [posted at the HHS website](https://aspr.hhs.gov/legal/PHE/pages/default.aspx).
* The intention is for this question to resolve based on any public health emergency declared by the HHS. Therefore, this question does not have additional requirements beyond the declaration (for example, human-to-human transmission is not required).
* In the event the law is changed such that a non-HHS agency is expected to be responsible for declaring such emergencies, Metaculus may clarify or annul this question.
* The state or territory designated for the public health emergency is immaterial, any declaration will count.
question_fine_print.124:
* Because PEPFAR was created by law, an enacted law that satisfies one of the above requirements would resolve the question as **Yes** immediately. In the event a presidential action would satisfy the above, the question will resolve as **Yes** if the action has taken effect for 60 consecutive days without being stayed, blocked, or otherwise halted by a federal court. In the event a presidential action is temporarily blocked by a court but later goes into effect for 60 days the question will resolve as **Yes**. The 60 day period must complete before January 1, 2026.
* Partial termination or partial elimination of funding is not sufficient.
* PEPFAR being renamed will not count, as long as the core mission of funding global AIDS/HIV prevention and treatment remains intact within the same program.
question_fine_print.125:
* If both Elon Musk and another individual are ranked #1, this resolves as **No**.
* If the Billionaires Index is not available on December 31, 2025, this question will be resolved as the first day for which it is available. If it is not available before January 4, 2026, this question will be **annulled**.
* Bloomberg outlines its methodology [here](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/methodology/).
* In the event of Bloomberg changing its methodology for calculating the net worths of the individuals on its list, Admins will make a determination about whether the change is substantial enough to annul the question, at their discretion.
question_fine_print.126:
Unilateral actions by either party will have no impact on this question, only a mutual agreement qualifies.

Preliminary talks, frameworks, or informal understandings do not count. Only a formal, signed agreement qualifies.
question_fine_print.127:
\- The invocation must explicitly invoke the Insurrection Act or make reference to the legal provisions under the Act. A statement by Trump saying he could invoke the Act would not qualify. 

\- Metaculus will resolve this question according to [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_fine_print.128:
* An announcement that Harvard's certification will be restored on a date after July 1, 2025 will not suffice to resolve this question. The certification needs to be in effect for this to resolve.
* Getting the certification at any point on July 1, 2025 would resolve this question as **Yes**.
question_fine_print.129:
Only federal criminal indictments filed by the DOJ are considered.

This question will be resolved according to information published by [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) before January 1, 2026.
question_fine_print.131:
* If the domestic content requirements change, this question will resolve as **Yes** if the new requirements are at least as strict as those estabished by the IRA.
* The domestic requirements becoming mandatory for ITC only for specific categories of projects will not resolve this question.
question_fine_print.132:
Future targets (such as "by 2030") will be included in this question. If there are multiple targets for different dates, the highest of these will be used.

If different targets for each country are introduced, this question will resolve as the lowest target for any member state. If targets are determined by mathematical operation, such as based upon GDP, this question will use the lowest effective target for any member state as of the summit.

If the NATO summit is delayed or relocated that will not impact this question, unless it is delayed to after August 31, 2025, in which case this question will be **annulled**.
question_fine_print.133:
* This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the 6 happens for at least one full week, even if the previous order is afterwards restored within 2025.
* If any of the titles ceases to exist, this question will resolve as **Yes** *only if* the corresponding individual no longer holds the highest office in the country. For example, if the title of President of Russia ceased to exist, this question would *not* resolve as **Yes** if Putin became the Prime Minister.
* Regardless of the circumstances, if any of the named individuals continues to legally hold their respective office within their country (for example if they are on a medical leave of absence or have been stripped of day-to-day powers), that individual will not contribute to the question resolving as **Yes**.
question_fine_print.135:
* Metaculus will consult media characterizations of Trump's comments on Musk to aid in determining if criticism has occurred. Metaculus will assess multiple sources of various political leanings to aid in limiting bias in assessing whether Trump has publicly criticized Musk.
* A criticism must be public to count, indirect reports, such as reporting on private conversations or statements that occurred behind closed doors, will not count.
* Whether Musk is fired or resigns is immaterial.
* If the outcome is disputed, a panel of three Admins will vote on how the question should resolve.
question_fine_print.136:
* In case of ambiguity, Metaculus admins may wait up to February 1, 2026, to make a determination and may use all information published prior to that date.
* Deaths will be totaled over the entire calendar year.
* If reported death totals do not specify which conflict they occurred in (e.g., a total of Israeli military deaths without disaggregation between conflicts with Iran or Hezbollah), Metaculus may use available estimates to determine whether the threshold has been met.
* Deaths from covert ops or other rumored operations will not count, unless explicitly claimed by one of the countries or conclusively shown by independent parties to have been committed by overtly flagged forces of either military during the specified period.
* Deaths from attacks by and towards the [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps) will count, as they are a branch of the Iranian Armed Forces.
* Deaths caused by friendly fire do not count, as long as they are explicitly referred to as such by credible sources.
* Deaths caused indirectly, for example as a result of sabotage or cyber-warfare do not count.
* Direct effects of an attack (e.g. fires, building collapses, or other immediate consequences occurring within 24 hours of the attack) would be included in the count. Effects that develop over longer timeframes (e.g. economic disruption) would not be counted.
question_fine_print.137:
* If the domestic content requirements change, this question will resolve as **Yes** if the new requirements are at least as strict as those established by the IRA.
* The domestic requirements becoming mandatory for PTC only for specific categories will not resolve this question.
question_fine_print.138:
The number shown at the time of this question for FY 2024 is 271,484 (271,484 [Title 8](https://uscode.house.gov/browse/prelim@title8\&edition=prelim) Removals and 0 [Title 42](https://uscode.house.gov/browse/prelim@title42\&edition=prelim) Expulsions). Thus, double that number would be 542,968, and that would be the threshold for **Yes**. However, if ICE later revises the number for FY 2024 by the time it posts its FY 2025 figures, then the revised number reported at the time will be used. Following the resolution of this question, no further revisions to either FY 2024 or FY 2025 numbers will be taken into account.

In addition to Titles 8 and 42, any other authorities unambiguously included by ICE as part of its total number of reported deportations, expulsions or removals will also count.

If ICE stops timely publishing these figures at the main resolution source, the question may resolve based on other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_fine_print.139:
* Crypto tokens include stablecoins, such as USDC.
* The company has to include the product price in crypto in the product listing / details page or any step on the company website during checkout. If the price in crypto is only available when redirected to a payment service provider, this question will not resolve as **Yes**.
* Any core service or product offered by these companies counts as long as it is not experimental and was not created primarily to allow crypto purchases.
  * Examples of offerings that would resolve this question as **Yes** include, but are not limited to
    * Google: Ads, Pixel phones, Youtube premium, Google Cloud compute
    * Meta: Ads, VR devices
    * Amazon: Anything purchased from their e-commerce platform, Kindle Unlimited, AWS compute
    * Tesla: Cars, Solar Panels, Powerwall
    * X: Ads, X Premium
  * Examples of offerings that would *not* resolve this question as **Yes** include, but are not limited to T-shirts with the company logo, Google phone chargers, and Telsa vehicle accessories (e.g., tires).
* A company claiming it accepts crypto on its own will not resolve this question as **Yes**. At least one core product or service has to be actually purchasable with crypto.
question_fine_print.140:
* The question will resolve when both the EIA gas price and CPI inflation index for December 2025 are first publicly available and accessed by Metaculus.
* If data from the US EIA or the CPI from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) is not available, Metaculus may select a similar source of data or resolve as **Ambiguous** at their discretion.
* EIA's series ID for gas prices is `PET.EMM_EPMR_PTE_NUS_DPG.M`
* BLS' series ID for the consumer price index is `CPIAUCSL`
question_fine_print.141:
If the resolution source is no longer available or fails to be maintained, Metaculus may name an alternative resolution source, may use [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) to resolve the question, or may **annul** the question. Alternative sources should follow similar methodology as the one outlined by the [U.S. Press Freedom Tracker](https://pressfreedomtracker.us/frequently-asked-questions/):

> The U.S. Press Freedom Tracker adopts a functional definition of who is a journalist. It doesn’t matter whether the individual has a press pass or went to journalism school, whether they work for The New York Times or work for themselves. What matters is whether the person was performing an act of journalism. The Tracker will count journalists whose rights to gather and disseminate information were violated in the course of their work or as a result of their work.
question_fine_print.142:
* An OpenAI model has to have the highest Arena Score. Simply having a rank equal to 1 will not suffice to resolve this question as **Yes**, as models with different Arena Scores can share rank 1. 
* A tie for the highest Arena Score will count.
* The StyleControl option will not be selected for the comparison.
* If Chatbot Arena substantially changes its methodology or categories, Metaculus might correspondingly alter the resolution criteria or **annul** this question.
question_fine_print.143:
• The relevant survey will probably be published by [ <u>El País</u> ](https://elpais.com/noticias/barometro-el-pais/).

 • Voting intention refers specifically to the 18-24 age group and to direct voting intention data, as presented in the 40dB survey. You can consult [ <u>this example</u> ](https://ep00.epimg.net/infografias/encuestas40db/2025/02-barometro/2025_02_barometro_voto.pdf). If that range is not available, another nearby range will be used to represent the youth vote.

 • If the last 2025 40dB survey is published before October 1, 2025, this question will be **void**.
question_fine_print.144:
* This question is asking the amount that the deficit would increase, for example an increase in the deficit of \$1 billion would resolve this question as \$1 billion.
* The value used in the CBO report will be the net increase or decrease in the deficit, from both direct on-budget and off-budget deficits as well as from any nonscorable deficit effects.
* In the event that the spending and revenue portions are passed as separate reconciliation bills this question will resolve as the combined deficit effect from both bills, combining the total deficit estimates from both bills if necessary.
* Metaculus may use reports from credible sources of the CBO figures to aid in determining resolution. In the event the CBO report is not available within three months after the passage of the later of the spending and revenue portions of the bill, or in the event it is unclear how to arrive at a total deficit increase from the CBO report, Metaculus may use reporting and estimates from other credible sources to resolve this question.
* If the deficit is decreased, this question will resolve as **\<0 \$**. If it is increased more than \$8 trillion, it will resolve as **>8T \$**.
* This question is asked assuming a current-law baseline, in the event CBO reports both current-law and current-policy baselines this question will use the current-law baseline figures, and the question will be **annulled** if CBO does not use a current-law baseline in its cost estimate and such an estimate is unavailable from other credible sources.
